title: Highest Net Secondary Income
description: In 2023, India achieved a net secondary income of $101.9 billion, marking one of the highest figures globally.

title: Top Receiver of Net Current Transfers from Abroad
description: India received $106.5 billion in net current transfers from abroad in 2023, showcasing its strong global financial connections.

title: High Political Stability and Absence of Violence
description: India's political stability was assessed with 9 sources in 2023, indicating a robust evaluation framework.

title: Low Transaction Costs for Remittances
description: In 2023, the average transaction cost for sending remittances to India was just 0.54%, one of the lowest globally.

title: High Prevalence of Low-Birthweight Babies
description: In 2020, 27.4% of births in India were low-birthweight, highlighting a significant health challenge.

title: High Prevalence of Wasting Among Children
description: In 2020, 18.7% of children under 5 in India were affected by wasting, indicating a critical nutritional issue.

title: High Prevalence of Severe Wasting Among Children
description: In 2020, 7.5% of children under 5 in India suffered from severe wasting, a severe public health concern.

title: Limited Community Health Workers
description: In 2016, India had only 0.581 community health workers per 1,000 people, indicating a shortage in healthcare personnel.

title: Low Income Share for the Poorest 10%
description: In 2022, the lowest 10% of India's population held just 4.5% of the income, reflecting income inequality.
